column4: I've got ubuntu running and it seems to recognize eth0 just fine. It can see the router, I can get to it from other machines on the local network, but it doesn't appear to have internet access.
That's what I thought too, but it grabs an appropriate IP.
then your problem is, as i originally told you, DNS. ;)
ensure the DHCP server is passing valid addresses
It's using the same nameserver as other machines on the network that can ping out just fine.
then the DNS servers your Linux machine is using do not match what you think they are. reboot.
I'm still getting the same response from the nslookup in both places.
